metadata.title: CVE-2021-22569 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
An issue in protobuf-java allowed the interleaving ofcom.google.protobuf.UnknownFieldSet fields in such a way that would beprocessed out of order. A small malicious payload can occupy the parser forseveral minutes by creating large numbers of short-lived objects that causefrequent, repeated pauses. We recommend upgrading libraries beyond thevulnerable versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-22569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

elpa-protobuf-mode - 3.21.12-1ubuntu6
libprotobuf-java - 3.21.12-1ubuntu6
libprotobuf-lite32 - 3.21.12-1ubuntu6
libprotobuf32 - 3.21.12-1ubuntu6
libprotoc32 - 3.21.12-1ubuntu6
php-google-protobuf - 3.21.12-1ubuntu6
protobuf-compiler - 3.21.12-1ubuntu6
python3-protobuf - 3.21.12-1ubuntu6
ruby-google-protobuf - 3.21.12-1ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: protobuf package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.21.12-1ubuntu6').
